<JD_START>
Job Title: New Vehicle Engineering Specialist (General Assembly)

Location: Montgomery, AL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing, Production

Description:
We are looking for a New Vehicle Engineering Specialist in the General Assembly for our clients new Product Launch! This position will be based in Montgomery Alabama.  Position Summary:Technical Specialist for assembly areas in the General Assembly Department of an automotive manufacturing environment. Job requirements include preparation of process documents, equipment install/modification before new vehicle launch, monitoring and analyzing current production process and making improvement in 4M during non-launching time period.
Essential Functions:Serve as technical expert of assigned area during vehicle launchesCoordinate and lead project activities, including new equipment installation, supplier selection, and implementation phasesNeed to prepare spec package after reviewing requirement (Quality, Safety, UPH, Layout, Ergonomics etc.)Communicate with Advanced Vehicle Manufacturing Engineering Team in Korea and other relevant teams in R&D from Korea/USA for successful launch.Host video conference in new vehicle design improvement and status follow up meetingResponsible for preparation of the Assembly Process Sheets considering method and line condition with detailed picture and textWork content to be explained through a picture drawn in the workers’ position according to work content, work order and work status.Responsible to record the tightening torque from the install drawing after checking the bolt and nut quality from the standard part size. Utilize standard torque chart if install drawing is not availableDetermine the Man Hour based on MODAPTS and optimize allocationAnalyze and continuously improve performance of assigned area (safety, quality, production, cost, and human factors).Participate in Cross Functional Teams (CFT) and other problem solving teams, as directed by Senior Management.Serve as technical expert for Team Members, Team Leaders, including technical training, as required.Support daily production issues as required.Continually review technical developments in area of responsibility and propose new technology projects as appropriate.Prepare presentations/reports on current projects, progress, and issues to management.Understand and control labor allocation.Meet all other requirements as assignedAdminister, coordinate, and comply with all Business Management System (BMS), Environmental Management System (EMS), and Safety Management System (SMS) requirements.
Education:Bachelor’s degree in an Engineering discipline or equivalent desired
Related Experience:Experience in automotive machining processes, tooling capability, and dimensional quality systems desired0 – 10 years job related experience in an engineering/industrial environment preferred
Skills / Knowledge:MS Word, Excel, PowerPointCATIA or similar CAD program
Our team members enjoy industry-leading benefits such as:Competitive wages and bonus potential15 paid holidays, 3 personal days, and 10 paid vacation days93% Company-paid Medical, Dental, and Vision for Team Members and their families effective your first day!28 paid days off (depending on date of hire)401(k) savings plan with immediate company matchingDiscounts on new company vehiclesTuition assistance program availableFitness center, onsite cafeterias, and free team wear

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
